questions.question_text: A local bank wants to protect their card holder data. The bank should comply with the __________ standard to ensure the security of card holder data.

discussion.content: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) Organizations: Companies handling credit card information

Selected Answer: C
CND Book P.246

questions.question_text: Ross manages 30 employees and only 25 computers in the organization. The network the company uses is a peer-to-peer. Ross configures access control measures allowing the employees to set their own control measures for their files and folders. Which access control did Ross implement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A. NIPS (Network Intrusion Prevention System):

A NIPS actively blocks or stops malicious traffic, which affects traffic flow. This doesn’t align with the requirement of not affecting traffic.
B. HIDS (Host Intrusion Detection System):

Monitors activities on individual hosts or endpoints, such as system logs and file changes. It does not primarily monitor network traffic.
D. HIPS (Host Intrusion Prevention System):

Similar to HIDS but actively blocks threats on a host. It is more intrusive and affects traffic.
Thus, the solution Fred’s boss wants is a Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS).

questions.question_text:
Fred is a network technician working for Johnson Services, a temporary employment agency in Boston. Johnson Services has three remote offices in New
England and the headquarters in Boston where Fred works. The company relies on a number of customized applications to perform daily tasks and unfortunately these applications require users to be local administrators. Because of this, Fred's supervisor wants to implement tighter security measures in other areas to compensate for the inherent risks in making those users local admins. Fred's boss wants a solution that will be placed on all computers throughout the company and monitored by Fred. This solution will gather information on all network traffic to and from the local computers without actually affecting the traffic. What type of solution does Fred's boss want to implement?

choices.A: Fred's boss wants Fred to monitor a NIPS system.
choices.B: Fred's boss wants to implement a HIDS solution.
choices.C: Fred's boss wants a NIDS implementation.
choices.D: Fred's boss wants to implement a HIPS solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
CND Book P.2785
Class K fires involve vegetable oils, animal oils, or fats in cooking appliances.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can be used to suppress fire from Class K sources?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it should start with monitoring
